About Me

I am a final-year PhD student in Electrical Engineering at Stanford advised by Emmanuel Candes. I am broadly interested in signal processing, optimization and statistics, having received a BS in Electrical Engineering and a BA in Statistics with a minor in applied math from Rice University in 2015.

Research

  • Subgradient Descent Learns Orthogonal Dictionaries, ICLR '19.
    • with Yu Bai, Ju Sun
  • Near-optimal Method For Highly Smooth Convex Optimization, COLT '19.
    • with Sebastien Bubeck, Yin Tat Lee, Yuanzhi Li, Aaron Sidford
  • Complexity of Highly Parallel Non-Smooth Convex Optimization
  • Easy deployment to GitHub Pages

Feel free to email me at qjiang2 AT stanford DOT edu or find me at 380-U.
